title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: I have already restored several times the T2 in DFU mode, but no result, do you have any idea what it can be?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Restore completed in DFU, no errors?
When restore is done, Mac should continue with fresh install.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: Yes, I restore and then install Big Sur, but it keeps rebooting...

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: When you are in the CMD+R screen the mac doesn't turn off, only after you install macOS.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
In which moment of installation reboots?
Did you try Internet Recovery?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
The installation is not interrupted. When it starts for the first time, the Mac reboots.


The installation was done over the internet.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Try to boot in safe mode.
Any history fault available?
Also try starting in diagnostic mode.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
The board is perfect.
The customer reports that he is using it and turned it off out of nowhere. The cooler suddenly speeds up.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: In safe mode, it works normally.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Actually, fan spins to max?
Starting in diagnostic mode shows some error message?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
In safe mode, the fan turns normally. 

In diagnostics mode, it says " no problems found ".

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Possibly GPU issue.
I suppose its driver is not loaded booting in safe mode.
Check how it appears in system report.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: [ATTACH type="full"]60059[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: [ATTACH type="full"]60061[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: Only by reballing the GPU or by replacing it?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Mmmmh, looks like AMD graphics is in use.
Test the machine booting in normal mode, with external monitor connected.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
The mac shuts down in the middle of the startup and speeds up the fan.

no logo.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Try to discard peripherals issue.
Test first with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD connector.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
I have disconnected all the peripherals, but it still has the same defect.

[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78520, member: 682"]
Test first with external monitor, disconnecting internal LCD connector.
[/QUOTE]
I did this.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
In safe mode, run HWMonitor and post screenshot with all values

Adjust security settings to allow USB boot and test the machine with USB macOS.
Try to switch between GPU/iGPU with gfxcardstatus, if possible.

Can you login into macOS starting in SMC bypass?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
It does not go into SMC bypass mode.
Does not switch between GPU's[ATTACH type="full"]60065[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60066[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60067[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60068[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: Do PRAM reset 2-3 times, then DFU restore again (with new installation).

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: It still has the same defect, after the macOS installation is finished, the mac crashes the startup bar, shuts down, and speeds up the cooler.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Should be problem with some driver.
Check in system report if all devices are correctly listed.

Check if the machine boots in normal mode without battery.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
No sound driver

[ATTACH type="full"]60074[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: So there is no sound booting in safe mode?

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: exactly.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Inspect U6300 area, on both sides; possibly corrosion issue.
Check the small coils from its power rails.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: There are no signs of oxidation, I checked the thermal camera and it doesn't heat up.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
Then change U6300.
Once removed, check the traces to its pads.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: I have another 820-01700 board with another defect to compare.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: I removed it, the pads are normal.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
LA950 and LA950 get very hot. 
I replaced the u6300, but it is still without a driver.
It seems that there is a GPU defect because it showed a report.

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message: [ATTACH type="full"]60078[/ATTACH][ATTACH type="full"]60079[/ATTACH]

title: 820-01700 boot loop
message:
GPU failure was expected, but was strange to found it enabled and working in safe mode.

The report points to GPU issue indeed.
